pullRequest.body:
From FLT. Binary and finite products of modules with the module topology also have the module topology. 

---

https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:

- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

nodes.body:
### PR summary [c99e6bc6c8](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/20453/commits/c99e6bc6c8f261f96e16f7f1bc26a6f0125e8959)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ instPi`
`+ instProd`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: kbuzzard can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Looks great, thanks! Just a bunch of nitpicks.

I might add that I think it's a bit crazy that we have to write proofs like the `instPi` one here manually. I wonder who could write a tactic for this?

bors d+

Looks great, thanks! Just a bunch of nitpicks.

I might add that I think it's a bit crazy that we have to write proofs like the `instPi` one here manually. I wonder who could write a tactic for this?

bors d+

```suggestion
  -- But `i` can be written as (m, n) ↦ (m, 0) + (0, n)
```

```suggestion
variable {M : Type*} [AddCommMonoid M] [Module R M] [TopologicalSpace M] [IsModuleTopology R M]
variable {N : Type*} [AddCommMonoid N] [Module R N] [TopologicalSpace N] [IsModuleTopology R N]
```

Again this results from a clear-up of the proof and me not picking up the pieces. Thanks!

There is an argument for keeping named instances and that's that it's then possible to supply them later on with (`\tauR := moduleTopology`) or whatever); in the past I found this helpful but I'm getting better at doing these proofs now and they're looking more natural (for example the introduction of `P` defined to mean M x N but with a different topology so I need this crutch less.

```suggestion
  have : ContinuousAdd M := toContinuousAdd R M
  have : ContinuousAdd N := toContinuousAdd R N
```
Do you understand the difference? There is no discernable difference in the infoview *shrug*. All I know is "I means inline now".

```suggestion
  let τP : TopologicalSpace P := moduleTopology R P
  have : IsModuleTopology R P := ⟨rfl⟩
  have : ContinuousAdd P := ModuleTopology.continuousAdd R P
```
As you're probably aware, I'm doing this on purpose, with the logic being "I heard that I means something else now but actually in Lean 4 we often use it in the same places as Lean 3 anyway"

I think this helps clarify a bit:
```suggestion
  change @Continuous (M × N) P instTopologicalSpaceProd τP i
```

```suggestion
instance instProd : IsModuleTopology R (M × N) := by
```

```suggestion
instance instPi : IsModuleTopology R (∀ i, A i) := by
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Topology/Algebra/Module/ModuleTopology): finite products of modules.
